unit.title: Vehicle Ownership, Insurance & Collisions
objectives: Understand registration, title, and renewal basics and keep records up to date.
Explain California financial responsibility (insurance) requirements and proof.
Perform basic maintenance checks and keep safety equipment in working order.
Know what to do at a collision scene and how/when to report.
Reduce risk and legal issues by planning for emergencies and documentation.

sections.title: Registration, Title & Renewal
sections.summary: Keep your vehicle legal with proper documents and on-time renewals.

content.text: Your vehicle must have a valid title and registration with current address on file. Display valid plates and stickers as required.

items: Update address promptly after moving.
Complete transfer of title when buying/selling.
Follow state notices for smog or other requirements.

content.text: Renew on time to avoid penalties. Some vehicles require periodic emissions inspections based on state rules.

items: Watch for renewal notices.
Keep proof of compliance in your vehicle when needed.
Resolve holds or fines before renewal.

sections.title: Insurance & Financial Responsibility
sections.summary: Carry valid proof and understand coverage types.

content.text: California law requires financial responsibility, typically through liability insurance. Keep digital or paper proof available for law enforcement.

items: Liability covers damage/injury you cause.
Additional coverages: collision, comprehensive, uninsured/underinsured.
Penalties for no proof can include fines or impound in some cases.

lessons.title: After a Collision: Reporting & SR Forms

content.text: If a collision meets reporting thresholds (e.g., injury, certain property damage), you must file required reports within the stateâ€™s timeframe.

items: Contact law enforcement when required.
Notify your insurer promptly.
File DMV report forms (e.g., SR) when applicable.

sections.title: Maintenance & Safety Equipment
sections.summary: Prevent breakdowns and stay safe with regular checks.

content.text: Check tires, brakes, fluids, lights, and wipers regularly. Address warning lights promptly and keep a maintenance log.

items: Proper tire inflation and tread depth.
Brake responsiveness and noises.
Battery, belts, coolant, and oil levels.

content.text: Functioning headlights, brake lights, mirrors, and horn are essential. Carry an emergency kit suited to your region and season.

items: Reflective triangles, flashlight, first aid kit.
Water, blanket, phone charger.
Gloves and tire-changing tools.

sections.title: At the Scene: Step-by-Step
sections.summary: Stay calm, safe, and thorough after a collision.

content.text: Stop immediately, protect the scene if safe, and check for injuries. Call 911 for emergencies. Move vehicles out of travel lanes if minor and safe.

items: Turn on hazards; set out triangles if safe.
Do not admit fault at the scene.
Document damage, location, weather, and witness contacts.

content.text: Exchange names, addresses, driver license numbers, license plates, and insurance details. Follow state timelines for reports.

items: Take photos and note vehicle positions.
File DMV report if thresholds are met.
Notify parents/guardians if you are a minor.
